snippet: Scientists investigating Alzheimer’s found that mice lacking the protein SNX27 had the same learning and memory defects as mice with Down syndrome.
abstract: Dr Huaxi Xu study in journal Nature Medicine finds that extra copy of chromosome 21 found in people with Down Syndrome contributes to presence of syndrome by inhibiting production of protein known as SNX27, necessary to make certain receptors in brain fire properly.
lead_paragraph: Scientists investigating Alzheimer’s found that mice lacking the protein SNX27 had the same learning and memory defects as mice with Down syndrome.

headline.print_headline: Brain Chemistry: Protein Linked to Development Problems
headline.seo: Protein in Alzheimer’s Linked to Down Syndrome
